content.description:
Formerly the Hex project, it's the most obvious (and best) line on this boulder. I have to thank Tim for showing me this thing!

 Sit start on a flat rock on the ground with a right hand jam between another rock and The Hexagon Boulder itself. Depending on your height, the start may be a bit different. Pull over the lip of the overhung section eventually getting to a right gaston and then an undercling-ish jug about halfway up. Be careful to the top, but you're likely past the crux.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter.
content.location: This is on the South side of The Hexagon Boulder.

content.description: Sit start in the blocky, horizontal crack. Move into the jug sidepull to the right then to the slopey rail. Follow the slopey rail to the top.
content.location: This is on the side of the boulder facing Cave Boulder.

content.description: This is a large boulder located beyond the west end of the Palisades uphill from the 40 Degree Boulder. Approaching this boulder from the 40 Degree Boulder it looks like a hexagon. There are half a dozen or so problems on quality rock.
